thread.title: Arsenal press conference live updates as Arsene Wenger speaks ahead of FA Cup clash with Preston
thread.title_full: Arsenal press conference live updates as Arsene Wenger speaks ahead of FA Cup clash with Preston

author: Ben Burrows
title: Arsenal press conference live updates as Arsene Wenger speaks ahead of FA Cup clash with Preston
text:
Sport Arsenal press conference live updates as Arsene Wenger speaks ahead of FA Cup clash with Preston The Gunners travel north for the 3rd round of the FA Cup hoping to get back on track after another week to forget in the Premier League Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger faces the press after Bournemouth draw Share this video Watch Next 
It’s been another few days to forget for the Gunners boss with yet more points dropped away at Bournemouth in a title race that is rapidly slipping from their grasp. 
Oh and Alexis Sanchez has seemingly finally had enough and is ready for a move away. Fiddlesticks. 
Expect Wenger to be asked about his wantaway Chilean as well as what changes he might make for the trip North this weekend. Fair to assume the January transfer window will crop up once or twice too. 
We will have all of it for you right here so sit down, settle in, get a coffee on and stick with us for all of it. 08:05 Sanchez didn't speak to ANYBODY after Bournemouth draw 
Alexis Sanchez carried on his Bournemouth hissy-fit into the Arsenal dressing room - leaving his team-mates fearing he will leave. 
Striker Sanchez threw a tantrum on the pitch after Tuesday’s 3-3 draw , throwing his gloves to the floor and visibly showing his frustration over the Gunners suffering a major blow to their title hopes. 
The Chile international, currently locked in a contract stand-off, was obviously furious with his team-mates and the result, and did not speak to anyone afterwards. 
One source suggested Sanchez - known for his fiery temper - was angry at seeing players celebrating their fightback from 3-0 down with 20 minutes to go because he saw even a point at Bournemouth as a bad result if they want to win the title. (Photo: REUTERS) 07:56 Good morning 
Good morning ladies and gentlemen, how are we all on this fine and frosty Thursday? Splendid. Ready for your weekly dose of everyone’s favourite Frenchman? Of course you are. 
Yes, it’s that time of the week again and we will soon be joined by Arsene Wenger as he previews Arsenal’s FA Cup clash with Preston this weekend. 
It’s been another few days to forget for the Gunners boss with yet more points dropped away at Bournemouth in a title race that is rapidly slipping from their grasp. 
Oh and Alexis Sanchez has seemingly finally had enough and is ready for a move away. Fiddlesticks. 
Expect Wenger to be asked about his wantaway Chilean as well as what changes he might make for the trip North this weekend. Fair to assume the January transfer window will crop up once or twice too. 
We will have all of it for you right here so sit down, settle in, get a coffee on and stick with us for all of it. 
Without further ado, off we go. (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty) Share
